ai_choice.reason: The customer wants to make changes to his council flat and prefers online services that are clear and straightforward; this link provides permit information and likely offers simple online forms and updates, aligning with his needs for clear, accessible information and timely updates.

ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Choice
ai_choice.reason: The customer needs to apply for permission related to their flat, and this page provides online permit application information, which aligns with their need for a simple online form and updates about permissions.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Page
ai_page.body:
Resident parking permit information

Eligible households can purchase up to two resident parking permits. Resident permits will be issued to a specific vehicle and registration number. Resident permits can also be purchased monthly and transferred between different vehicles; please see the parking terms and conditions above for further information.
The charge for monthly permits is simply 1/12th of the annual cost. Permits will be issued virtually – you will not have a paper permit to display in the windscreen.
Please note that resident permits are issued per council tax reference number.
The parking permit application process will require you to supply your council tax number; you can find this on your council tax bill. Please note that to protect the information on your council tax account this number cannot be given to you over the telephone.

Apply for a resident permit

If you cannot apply online, please call 0333 123 5900.
Before making an application, please read the permit terms and conditions in the introduction box, as refunds cannot be provided.

I don't have a copy of my council tax bill - how do I apply?

If you do not have a copy of your bill you can:

  • Telephone or email your local council tax office to request another copy to be posted to your property.
  • Visit the council tax office to collect a copy of your bill. Please note you will need to ensure that you take photo identification with you which confirms your address; a copy of your bill cannot be given to you without identification.
  • If you have just moved in and need to register for council tax or notify a change of address, please contact your local council tax office.

If you have just moved in and need to register for council tax or notify a change of address, please contact your local council tax office. Alternatively, you can supply the following documents as evidence to obtain a temporary reference number (please note that this is not a council tax number) that can be used to apply for a parking permit via MiPermit:

  • Tenancy agreement for the new property.
  • Completion documents from a solicitor in relation to the new property.
  • A utility bill (with the new address clearly printed on the bill).
  • A new council tax liability form in relation to the new property.
  • Bank statement (with the new address clearly printed on the statement).

This page contains information on how to apply for resident permits and visitor vouchers.
Parking permits are issued by Gloucestershire County Council. If you are a resident in a permit zone, and you have a current council tax number then you are eligible for two parking permits and 50 visitor vouchers per year (see below).
Information leaflet - permit schemes - including new permit and voucher charges from June 2023.
Please read our terms and conditions document for all permit types.

Last reviewed: 16/10/2023

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Feedback

ai_issue.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Issue

ai_improvement.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Improvement

text_issues.Issue: The text discusses resident parking permits, which is unrelated to applying for flat improvements, causing confusion for the user seeking specific information about flat modifications.
text_issues.original:
Resident parking permit information

Eligible households can purchase up to two resident parking permits. Resident permits will be issued to a specific vehicle and registration number. Resident permits can also be purchased monthly and transferred between different vehicles; please see the parking terms and conditions above for further information.
The charge for monthly permits is simply 1/12th of the annual cost. Permits will be issued virtually – you will not have a paper permit to display in the windscreen.
Please note that resident permits are issued per council tax reference number.
The parking permit application process will require you to supply your council tax number; you can find this on your council tax bill.
Please note that to protect the information on your council tax account this number cannot be given to you over the telephone.

Apply for a resident permit

If you cannot apply online, please call 0333 123 5900.
Before making an application, please read the permit terms and conditions in the introduction box, as refunds cannot be provided.

I don't have a copy of my council tax bill - how do I apply?

If you do not have a copy of your bill you can:

  Telephone or email your local council tax office to request another copy to be posted to your property.
  Visit the council tax office to collect a copy of your bill. Please note you will need to ensure that you take photo identification with you which confirms your address; a copy of your bill cannot be given to you without identification.
  If you have just moved in and need to register for council tax or notify a change of address, please contact your local council tax office.

If you have just moved in and need to register for council tax or notify a change of address, please contact your local council tax office. Alternatively, you can supply the following documents as evidence to obtain a temporary reference number (please note that this is not a council tax number) that can be used to apply for a parking permit via MiPermit:

  Tenancy agreement for the new property.
  Completion documents from a solicitor in relation to the new property.
  A utility bill (with the new address clearly printed on the bill).
  A new council tax liability form in relation to the new property.
  Bank statement (with the new address clearly printed on the statement).

This page contains information on how to apply for resident permits and visitor vouchers.
Parking permits are issued by Gloucestershire County Council. If you are a resident in a permit zone, and you have a current council tax number then you are eligible for two parking permits and 50 visitor vouchers per year (see below).
Information leaflet - permit schemes - including new permit and voucher charges from June 2023.
Please read our terms and conditions document for all permit types.

Last reviewed: 16/10/2023
text_issues.improvement: Please note this page is about parking permits, not how to request permission for flat improvements. To apply for flat modifications, please visit our dedicated flat improvement application section or contact the housing team directly.
text_issues.why: Removing unrelated parking permit information clarifies the focus, making it easier for users like David to find specific instructions on requesting flat modifications, aligning the content with his needs.

text_issues.Issue: The current text does not provide a direct, clear process for submitting requests to modify a flat, which was the main concern for the user.
text_issues.original: The parking permit application process will require you to supply your council tax number; you can find this on your council tax bill.
text_issues.improvement: To request permission for flats improvements such as installing a new kitchen or handrail, please complete our online improvement request form available here [insert link], or contact the housing team for guidance.
text_issues.why: Providing a specific call-to-action and direct link offers clarity and makes it easier for users to understand how to proceed with their request, addressing their concern about the application process.

text_issues.Issue: The existing content does not address the user's concern about delays or updates in the approval process for flat improvement requests.
text_issues.original: Please read the permit terms and conditions in the introduction box, as refunds cannot be provided.
text_issues.improvement: Once you submit your flat improvement request, you will receive regular updates via email or SMS about its progress, so you stay informed without delays or guesswork.
text_issues.why: Specifying that users will receive updates improves transparency, alleviates worries about delays, and reassures them that they will be kept informed throughout the process.

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Gloucestershire - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
To: CEO  
From: Web Usability Manager  
Subject: Recommendations for Improving Flat Improvement Application Process Based on Customer Feedback  

Dear CEO,

After reviewing the recent customer persona, feedback, and content issues related to our online services, I have identified key areas where targeted improvements can significantly enhance user experience, efficiency, and potential cost savings for the council.

**Positive Feedback and Recognition:**  
Firstly, I would like to commend the web team for their ongoing efforts. The existing pages are informative and demonstrate a solid foundation for the user journey. The clarity around parking permits is appreciated, and these pages are well-structured, which is a good sign of quality.

**Areas for Improvement and Recommendations:**  
The primary concern from the customer persona, David, is that the current content does not address his specific needs regarding flat modifications, such as installing a new kitchen or handrail. Instead, the page provides unrelated information about parking permits, causing confusion and frustration.  

To address this, I recommend the following targeted improvements:  

1. **Create a Dedicated Flat Improvement Request Section:**  
   - Develop a clearly labeled online form or webpage specifically for flat modification requests.  
   - Include step-by-step instructions, eligibility criteria, required documentation, expected processing times, and a timeline.  
   - Add a direct link or prominent button, e.g., "Request Flat Modifications," linking to this form.

2. **Implement Clear Communication and Update Mechanisms:**  
   - Enable automated email/SMS updates to keep applicants informed about submission receipt, processing stages, and decisions.  
   - This will reassure users like David, reducing anxieties about delays and missed updates, thereby improving customer satisfaction and reducing inbound queries.

3. **Eliminate Confusing Content from Unrelated Pages:**  
   - Remove parking permit information and other unrelated content from the flat modification guidance pages.  
   - Instead, provide concise, relevant instructions specific to flat improvement requests, including contact options for further assistance.

**Impact of These Improvements:**  
- **Enhanced User Experience:** Customers will find the process straightforward and relevant, reducing confusion and frustration.  
- **Operational Efficiency:** Clear guidance and automated updates can decrease the volume of manual inquiries, freeing staff resources and reducing administrative costs.  
- **Cost Savings:** Streamlining digital communications and reducing unnecessary calls or follow-ups leads to better resource management and potential budget savings.  
- **Greater Trust and Transparency:** Transparent updates and easy-to-follow processes boost user trust in council services.

In summary, by focusing on content relevance and process clarity—particularly creating a dedicated, easy-to-access flat improvement request pathway—we can significantly improve customer satisfaction and operational efficiency, ultimately benefiting the council financially and reputationally.

Please let me know if you'd like me to prepare a more detailed implementation plan.

Best regards,  
[Your Name]  
Usability & Web Strategy Lead
